column4: helllo, when i boot with a usb-disk plugged in the system hangs, how can i solve this ?
hangs how? does linux at least partially start? and errors?
well the system starts to boot and after 5s it hangs
do you see anything to do with linux? or is it just your bios stuff ?
: are you using edgy or dapper
edgy
can you boot *without* the usb stuck in?
yes works fine
when you try to boot from the USB, when it hangs, does it say something about waiting for root filesystem? or a kernel-panic, unable to find root fs?
no i am not booting from it . and it somehow starts to start linux ... well I will try again to get the excqct error ... one second
but did you see any errors at the point it hung?
yes - well actually there is no error
did it say anything about root filesystems?
perhaps pastebin your dmesg output, and highlight where it hung

than it hangs and when i unplug the disk it continues with : [17179577.524000]  PCI: Enabling device 0000:00:1c.3 (0000 -> 0002) [17179577.524000]  ACPI: PCI Interrupt 0000:00:1c.3[D]  -> GSI 23 (level, low) -> IRQ 193  [17179577.524000]  ehci_hcd 0000:00:1c.3: EHCI Host Controller [17179577.524000]  ehci_hcd 0000:00:1c.3: new USB bus registered, assigned bus number 3
it's not what i thought it might be then. ooi, can you access that usb key if you plug it in after you've booted?
yes - do you still want me to paste my dmesg output ?
no need
its  a fat fs might that be a problem ?
it should not matter in the slightest
maybe your stick is a bit knackered
